title: War Memorial..!! A must visit place
review: The war memorial gives you every peice of information about the 1971 Indo-Pak war. No permit is necessary to visit Longewala War Memorial. They also have a military canteen where you can get maggi, omlette etc. There are nearby restaurants too..!!

title: very peace and calm area,no pollution must visit
review: place is very beautiful, peaceful, no pollution, we love it

title: Feel the Pride
review: This memorial is built on the war-place so instill the patriotism and proud. The movie Border is based in the same war and a part of the shooting was done on the same place. It's around 100 km from Jaisalmer and takes around 2 hours so good to visit if one has the time. Also, one needs border pass to visit the border area so get it a day before the travel from Jaisalmer.

title: Feel the pride
review: The post of longewala ! 1971 war or the movie border , whichever you can think of faster is based on this very land. A place where bravery is etched in every corner. The museum like the entire little area is under army and pretty well taken care of. If you come to Jaisalmer, take a cab and travel 120 kms to see longewala!!! Make sure you smile or salute the soldiers you see around.

title: Must Visit Place
review: The war memorial is very well laid out. The audio-Video shaow is excellent. Makes every visitor  proud of the Indian Army.

title: a must visit for every indian @ jaisalmer
review: if you visit jaisalmer pls take time & visit the Longewala war memorial its a 2 hr drive, pay your homage to the brave soldiers who defended this post during 1971 war.

title: how is the josh
review: It is a must place to visit to pay homage to our brave armed forces personnel. It is a 2 hour drive from Jaisalmer. It can be combined along with visit to Tanot matha temple & the Pak border ( with prior permission only).

title: Longerwala - Where emotions cannot be subdued
review: Very well maintained. Would recommend anyone visiting this place to also visit the Indo-Pak border by taking permission from the BSF office in the Jaisalmer city

title: The Valor
review: just seeing the location makes one feel the audacity with which the Indian company fought two advancing Pakistani divisions one of those armored for more than 6 hours all alone without any reinforcement. It is beyond imagination that those brave soldiers fought looking in the eyes of death and defeated the advancing army. It is now golden history of bravery on this golden land.

title: Revisiting the History
review: It's another drive from Jaisalmer. But then if you have reached there would you not drive a bit more and touch the soil tales of which you have been listening to all along. It is a must. If you go till Jaisalmer, you have to go further. Fills you with certain emotions, seeing what you see and feeling what you fee.

title: Wonderful place to visit with family
review: This was one of the highlights of our visit to Jaisalmer. Its a small memorial with a museum and war artefacts with guidance from jawans stationed there. Dont miss the short movie screening, it captures the essence of the war and the sacrifices. Its great for the kids to get a real feel for history and for them to appreciate the value of peace and what our defence forces give to society. Overall, well worth the drive up to the border.

title: family visit
review: this is the place, every one should visit, young generation should how our hero,s

title: Salute to the Legendary  Warriors
review: If you do not visit longe wala tanot ,your jaisalmer trip is not complete. i was travelling with my family its great to learn about our army. we felt so proud that how we fought the war against pakistan with very few soldiers. apart from this is very beautiful landscape . which you can not see in commercial dunes like sam an khuri

title: In to the Border Movie reality
review: Visited this place during  Oct 17.

title: A Glimpse Into Brave-hearts's Brave Action during 1971 Indo-Pak War; "Border" Movie's Inspiration
review: Although Longewal was ever famous in the books of Military History, but it was only after the Bollywood movie of 1997 "Border" was a huge box-office success that the place became all the more famous pan-India and internationally. Earlier, the place was wide open ground with a small roundel where four road meet. All the briefings used to take place place from a vantage point by the Army or BSF. Later, the Army decided to develop into a war memorial with various Indian Army war equipment and Pakistani captured war trophies including their destroyed tanks tanks. The war memorial complex is overlooked by a large Indian tricolour fluttering up in the sky. All this gives a sense of immense pride and achievements to a normal citizen who comes to visit this place. It also has an audio-visual underground theatre which is developed in the form of a bunker with walls and seats made up of sand bags. A documentary movie giving out the entire details of Battle of Longewal is given. There is also a visitors room (only for defence personnel) and a cafeteria being run by the Army personnel for all tourists.

title: Excellent - Breathtaking
review: To be at a place where a battle was fought and won by our mighty Army was a privilege. The place is an open museum and is merely meters away from the India-Pak border fencing. The enemy tanks and vehicles captured during the war of 1971 are on display. If you are in Jaisalmer you must must visit this place. The energy of this place is worth witnessing.

title: Good story of 1971 war
review: This is a war memorial but you should try to go to Longewala village which is the actual battle ground. Battle ground is almost 80km from Jaisalmer. But you will see war captured paki tanks and trucks. The villages enroute are beautiful and a must stop for photography

title: Brings out all the patriotic feelings
review: The short 15 minute films sums it all up so well. The battle at Longewal fought in 1971 still evokes a lump in your throat. The physical reminders of the long forgotten war remind us of our vulnerability and the steadfastness of the jawaans guarding our borders so selflessly...

title: The bettle less known
review: It the same ground where a fierce bettle was fought between indian and pak army in 1971. The place is located deep in jaisalmer near india pak border . It tells the story about the bravery of great indian soldiers who fought hard to scare away the enemy, even when our army was hugely outnumbered. The same bettle was shown in border movie. There is a meuseum in laungewala where you can get all the info about the bettle. There is a real pakistani tank which our soldiers captured. One should definitely visit this if he/she is coming to jaisalmer.

title: Must visit
review: 110 km from Jaisalmer, this memorial commemorates unprecedented bravery, heroism & tactical superiority of a small company of Indian army facing a whole brigade of enemy.

title: The place where our brave soldiers shed their blood to protect our motherland from enemies in 1971
review: This is great place to visit. Its roughly 2.5 hours journey from Jaisalmer. The roads have been well maintained by BRF and you will find very nice terrains on the way to this place. I would suggest to start your journey early in the morning to enjoy the fullest.

title: Feel the Longewala glory
review: Small place to get to know Longewala 1971 war with our un-friendly neighborhood.

title: Wonderful petrotic place
review: Winter is best time to visit, roads are excellent. One hour drive from jaisalmer.

title: Valor place
review: I was spellbound while seeing this nice place,a milestone of patriotism..

title: Very informative
review: The place is well maintained and its quite  informative in itself. Only thing which i found little odd was the plates with description of the incidents were too much sentimental and emotional. These emotions are for the visitors to feel themselves just by looking at the place. Certain things are more effective when left unsaid ! But again thats purely my belief...

title: Disappointing
review: We are all OCI holder. We drove from Jaisalmer (2 hours drive) to this place with Indian heart and pay homage to our soldiers. What we got there was: we were returned back to our coach from entrance saying we are foreigners and can’t be allowed to visit this place. Couple of them were rude. Even though we are NRI we are Indian by heart and soul. Destiny took us away from our country doesn’t mean we don’t have any feelings for our country. It made us very sad and felt stranger in our own country. This was saddest part of our holiday. It still hurts

title: Desh premi (patriotism)
review: Hey friends,

title: Fill the heart with pride
review: One of the best places to pay respect to the soldiers. Well maintained. Good enough details. Items available for purchase.

title: Nice natural museum
review: Though a little far from the main city but quite a decent day trip. You can club it with the border and tanut mata mandir. For border, always take the permission from the city. No one gets the permission after reaching there.

title: Best way to explore yourself
review: If you want to explore yourself during Jaisalmer Trip then You must head out to Longewala War Memorial where you'll see lots of contribution done by our soldiers. Also, the way to Longewala itself was a new experience because of long road.

title: A Truly Heroic Place
review: A must see place on the way to Jaisalmer. Movie was good but need to give more theatre feeling.   must see place on the way to Jaismalre

title: Longewala War Memorial
review: Longewala War Memorial, is one of the must see place in Jaisalmer. it shows that, how our real heros, our soldiers are protecting us. after visiting this place i am really feeling proud on our indian army. it is almost 120 km away from jaisalmer, but every one should visit this place.

title: Must visit
review: The place is must visit place and located about 120 kms from Jaisalmer. Carry light food and water during the journey from Jaisalmer. Snacks and tea is available near the war memorial. If you have seen hindi movie Border you will remember all the war scenes there. few captured/destroyed vehicles/tanks of enemy pakistan have been kept there.

title: Excellent place for defense fans
review: This is a good idea but the only good time to visit is in Nov to February. the place is beautiful and inspirational.

title: Wow amazing place must visit best place
review: One of the best place to visit if you like history tanks guns, there were amazing real tanks parked it was just amazing.

title: must watch
review: it is a nice place to bring our childrens,different varieties of war plane ,guns .they also revealed the startergic moves in both indo pak and indo china wars.atleast we spent 1hour there

title: A very well presented story of our war
review: Well presented facts and information. Our Jawans were very helpful through out the visit. Should surely take children for a visit.

title: Must visit place
review: This historic place is tribute to our military force. This will remind you situation of war against Pakistan.

title: Good meseum
review: Museum seems good but there should be a guide (may be paid) to walk thru the story there. Also the movie screening should be more regular.

title: Great experience
review: Must visit this place.  It was a great experience.

title: One feels patriotic while visiting this place.
review: I started from Jaisalmer and reach Longewala in around 2 hours. The entire journey is very calm with very less traffic and beautiful roads. After reaching Longewala and doing the paperwork, we headed to the memorial. You can find the army bunkers here, captured two pakistani tanks, a movie show. One feels great sense of patriotism while visiting this place.

title: Amazing visit to the War Museum
review: You cannot miss this when you visit Jaisalmer.  Though a routine visits needs a 45 minute stay, you can spend a neat couple of hours if you intend to go through the Museum in detail.  Memoirs, pictures, the audio visual show...all of it managed by the Fauji's gets us a decent experience

title: Must visit if you go to Jaisalmer
review: If you are traveling to Jaisalmer take a day out and do surly visit this memorial.  Longewala War Memorial is a memorial which will relive the 1971 war for you. You may feel proud to be here if you are Indian.

title: This war museum has to be on your list when you visit Jaisalmer.
review: Like any other War Memorial this too has story of Bravery to tell. They have tankers ans and other war ammunition on display. visitors can also watch an audio visual narrating the war time story.

title: Salute and respect
review: The Indian soldiers there welcomes you and explain you that part of history where you will surely salute the Indian Army for protecting civilians who least brothers about these great Heroes. A must visit place during your Jaisalmer trip even if it costs you 1more day...

title: Longewala - A hidden treasure
review: We visited longewala after visiting Tanot.

title: Visit to this battleground
review: We visited Longewal battleground. There is a open museum. You can see tanks captured from Pakistan army & you can watch AV show as well. It is maintained by BSF. The battle took place in 1965 when Pakistan army reached there 15km inside the border. Finally with few soldiers & help from Indian air Force they took control.

title: its an amazing palce to visit
review: we were lucky to get permission to visit the Longewala border post ,and you feel proud of the Indian army and indian soldiers ,the way they protect the border to make our life safe n secured.Hats off to the Indian Army.

title: Million salutes to our real heroes
review: Must visit this place to get an inkling of what our soldiers go through to keep us safe. Very nicely made with photos and information about how the Indian army was formed, the various wars fought by India, tales of bravery of our soldiers and the gear used. Also on display are tanks and vehicles....both ours and Pakistan's(captured in 1971 war) and a phased out fighter jet. Also has a souvenir shop and cafe teria.

title: Humbled!
review: As you approach the war memorial, you feel a deep stirring inside and then goose bumps take over...The sights of war trophies - Pakistani war tanks being displayed proudly at our turf make you feel so proud of the grit and valor those 120 Iron Men displayed during the battle of 1971. Once inside, you can see various military equipment, battle pictures, unit medals, various accounts of the battle and testimonials - helping us relive those tough yet historically important times in modern India. Do not miss the 20 minute long movie displayed for tourists in an actual bunker at Longewala site. Border Pillar 638 is displayed right outside the memorial. Longewala is a must visit for people travelling to Jaisalmer and is ~120 kms (2 hours drive) and is Holy Ground for all Indians. Jai Hind

title: Felt a pang of patriotism
review: Mixed emotions including but not limited to Heartwarming, heart touching, heart melting and heart burning

title: a remainder of bravery
review: the place a little off-town, but do plan the visit while going there one can also visit the tanot mata temple. it is at the border pakistan and india share. also they show some graet documentaries.

title: Tribute to solidier and must visit for every traveller who is travelling to Jaisalmer
review: This lies just before you enter jaisalmer. Very neat and well maintained complex show casing our engagements with Pakistan on the western front..and also Kargil. Worth spending 1 hour or so going through the various exhibits and also watch a 20mts movie if you can spend that additional time. Worth watching.

title: Great historical place
review: We visited Longewala war museum in October 2018. This museum was excellent. They have shown a documentary for about 20 minutes. Visiting this place is one of the best moments in my life. Salute to our Indian army for their great service to the country.

title: Emotional patriot proud moments
review: Feeling of pride and valour engulfed our whole being. The place reminded of sacrifices of our forces and the way they keep us protected from all border threats

title: The "Longewala" war memorial which always makes India proud
review: It is almost 100 kms from Jaisalmer but it is worth visiting.It is the place which speaks the courage and valor of Indian Army.  The road to Longewala is beautiful but deserted.

title: Inspiring Place to Visit
review: The Longewala War Memorial is an open air museum cum memorial  at the site of the famous Battle of Laungewal which took place between Indian Army and Pak Army on 04/05 Dec 1971. The memorial is very well organised with various information boards and two captured Pak tanks on display. There is a also a short movie screening for the tourists which is very good. Definitely a must place to visit.

title: This area is under Army
review: Good place for the people who interested in indian army and want to feel patriotic , a very good movie here

title: Honor to step in the land of Bravery
review: Salut to the Heros and the true warriors; Their willpower  and patriotism overcast the high-tech warheads and they enemies had to run away - cannot forget these heroes. We sleep peacefully as our BSF is on guards all the time managing such difficult terranes, Water and a shelter in this baron Thar desert is a wishful thinking!

title: Closed for renovation
review: We visited today afternoon and were informed that the museum and audio-visual movie theater was closed for renovation. Do check with your guides before going.

title: Visit once if you can
review: This area is under army supervision.

title: Wonderful experience
review: Lovely jeep safari, camel ride by all five members of the family and folk songs by local people, have impressed us to visit again.

title: a great salute to our nation hero
review: after visiting came to know more facts which was not known to me earlier

title: Excellent if you are interested in Indo-Pak war history.
review: This place is about 100 Kms from Jaisalmer.Visit this along with Tanot Mata ki mandir. And don't forget the to get the permission from BSF office in Jaisalmer to visit the border.The also run a movie (Rs 40 entry ticket) but the maximum part of it is taken from the bollywood movie BORDER.

title: If you are going to Jaisalmer don’t forget to go longewala war memorial
review: If you are going to Jaisalmer don’t forget to go longewala war memorial. Place is few kilometres away from Jaisalmer. And the road is so awesome and beautiful if you are driving you will love it. Both side of road is covered with beautiful desert. Place is so inspirational place and also go to tanaut mata mandir which few more km and so historical related to india Pakistan war.

title: Longewala war meusem
review: We all visited this place in hope to see the museum and to  get a pass to nearby border pillar .The museum is great and one will feel the patriotism and also great for photography as the captured tanks and   jeep.₹ 40 is ticket price for a short film displayed in underground barack cum theater.This short film is very informative .It must be on visitors list. Secondly if one want to go to border pillar,one must get the order from bsf office at Ramgadh..Physically as despite being contacts at Ramgarh due to no mobile signal we were unable to collect the form.

title: Nothing better than visiting this place other than to pay homage to the fallen soldier
review: Once you reach there you are greeted by the sentries after producing the identity you can visit the war memorial and hear the briefings on the war , there is small theatre showcasing the value of the soldiers of that time and the documentary to show the valour

title: Longewala War Memorial
review: First of all really great place, I visited this place with my brother-in-laws, longewala war memorial is 110km from Jaisalmer via ramgarh. This is boarder place so please hold your  identity card with you. Dummy Tanks, Bankers and Jeeptank are the photo spots at there. Best time to visit is winter because in summer the temperature is almost near to 50 digree. and dont forget to reach before 5 o'clock to enjoy.

title: must visit
review: highly advisable to visit this place. We visited with our family that had kids too. weather was perfect too.

title: History recreated
review: A must visit place. Its a modal representation of indo pak war of 1971 i.e how 120 soldier of Indian army save the post from tank battalion of Pakistan. Movie Border is based on the same story.

title: Longewala
review: Longewala needs no introduction.The memorial offers you a time travel in the brave history of Indian Army & the supreme sacrifice they made in 1971 Indo-Pak war.The Memorial contains arms which were used in the war.Its also contains war trophies like Pak tanks & guns which were seized by victor force of India.A must visit

title: Indo Pak War Place
review: its really worth to visit but have lot of hurdles as its a border zone one can visit there and spend the few time to understand out situation and can see the physical tank of Pak army

title: Must visit if you're a history lover
review: Happened to visit this on my second trip to Jaisalmer along with my family and grandmom. She loved it. So did my mom and dad. They were thrilled to see tanks and artillery lying in the middle of the desert. Minutes away lay the Pakistan border which just added to the thrill of the entire place.

title: PATRIOTIC FEELINGS
review: The 1971 war on which superhit movie BORDER is based on.

title: Longewal war memorial
review: After visiting the sand dunes of Jaisalmer, next day visit Tanot mata temple maintained by BSF,if want to go to the border, you have to get a permit a few earlier from Jaisalmer. Otherwise go to longewal through the sand dunes on either side of the road. History is in front of your eyes, the tanks captured with the other arms captured are displayed. There is a film show giving all the details of the war , soldiers posted their give out the details with a glee. A must visit for the younger generation

title: Amazing place - must visit
review: This is where the border movie shooting happened. They show movie clips every sometime. The people are super nice and the place is awesome. Must visit while you’re there.

title: Border
review: While visiting a temple Tanot Mata after that we visit longewala very nice experience, great history of indian army how we win over enemies, Mind Blowing Memories....

title: Good Place
review: A must visit place if you visit Jaisalmer !!! Reminds us about the situation faced by our soldiers in tough times .

title: Iconic site
review: Visited this place end of December 2017. One more historic site which will make you swell with pride when you visit it. The iconic place makes you relive the 1971 Indo- Pak battle won by India. The place exhibits the history of this war by display of war photographs, weapons, battle tanks and jeeps of both sides. Our driver was very proud to talk of this place explaining as to how the Indian army is now occupying the won area which was earlier under Pakistan. The Pakistan army had to retreat back losing a considerable amount of land to the Indian army in this battle. The Army manages this post now. You will find a small cafeteria  with take away snacks, tea / coffee vending machine run by the army personnel.  You can watch a short film which is run in intervals for a nominal fee to make people aware of the 1971 battle happenings. You will surely come out feeling more patriotic after having watched it.You can cover the Tanot Mata temple – Longewala post – Kuldhara– Sam sand dunes in this one trip to outskirts of Jaisalmer.

title: bravery of indian soldiers
review: this place is some 40 kms from tanot temple and 100 kms from jaisalmer city. once to reach the place your heart will full with pride and emotions run high for the soldiers. Its the place where 120 indian soldier defended their check post  from approx 2000 pakistani soldiers with tanks and vehicles. there is small movie clip of 15 min duration describing the war and bravery of soldiers. One can also get refresh by having some snacks and drinks at cafeterias run by army personnel's as journey along with tanot temple of 6-7 hours offers very little eating joints ont he way.

title: Longewal war memorial
review: Gone to this memorial by tanot mata,good collection of captured pak tanks  with army displays video regarding ind pak war at longewal....

title: great to see india winning the battle
review: Longewala war memorial greets you with a T 59 pakistani tank. that was captured during 1971 war. fantastic visit to understand the sacrifices of our army and the bravery of some of the officers and jawans. definitely should be part of everyone jaisalmer visit iternary

title: Do not miss
review: learning about the wars and this special instance of bravery is a great experience for every Indian. One gets chills while reading the story and watching the short film about how India won that time.

title: Must must visit
review: One of the must visit places of jaisalmer.The drive to longewala from tanot in itself is an amazing experience.

title: Re-live the Longewala Heroics of the INDIAN ARMY!!
review: Situated at the exact place where the 71' Longewala Battle took place, the Longewala War Memorial isn't a place to miss if you've grown up watching the cult film 'Border'.

title: Brilliant and splendid!!
review: Located a far away from the hustling town of Jaisalmer. Its a 4 hour travel and its worth it.

title: Best place
review: Longewala war memorial is place to memories our war heroes who martyr for nation, best place to visit. All memories of India Pak 1971 war memories are placed there.

title: Must go place while in Jaisalmer
review: The place is about 2 hours - 105 kms drive from main city of Jaisalmer. The drive is scenic and the roads are well built by BRO.

title: Must visit
review: Longewala war memorial is 2 hours drive from the Jaisalmer, can be clubbed with the visit to Tanot mata temple. We visited it in early February with our own vehicle. You'll pass through some the spectacular sand dunes landscape on the way. Do keep your identification cards as these will be checked at Longewala.

title: Trip to Jaisalmer/Longewala Post - one of the most memorable trip
review: I personally feel that Jaisalmer trip is not complete  if you have not visited Longewala post

title: A must visit for every Indian
review: The visit to the Longewala War Memorial left me & my wife with lumps in our throats. The memorial is 15 kms from the border & being there brought the reality & the awesome achievement of our soldiers during the 1971 war to life. The movie clip, interspersed with clips from the popular Bollywood film Border, are very well done. Makes ones heart swell with pride thinking of the contributions of the small band of soldiers in preventing the enemy from making inroads towards Jaisalmer.

title: Relive the Border movie
review: Must visit place if you want to relate further to the movie Border. Do not miss the audio video clip.

title: Worth a visit
review: Longewala War Memorial is more than 80 kms away from Jaisalmer town. But it is a must visit place since the army unit there played a stellar role in thwarting the pakistani army from occupying Indian territory in 1971.

title: Proud Indian
review: One of the Best place to visit in Jaisalmer, you can actually visualise about the 1971 Ind-Pak War.

title: Border Movie
review: Actual Locations

title: A little far, but definitely worth it!
review: The famous bollywood movie, 'Border' was made primarily about this check post of BSF. In december 1971, Pakistan's tanks reached this post and though indians were in a very few number, they fought and won the battle. Actual tanks are kept here, you can see audio-visual show, and also a museum. There is a small cafe, you can try Maggi there, its awesome. I visited this place on the occasion of holi, where the jawans were celebrating the festical of colors, and we celebrated with them too. The place is located around 100-120 kms from jaisalmer, you can also visit famous Tanot Mata temple, you can easily hire a taxi for to and fro from jaisalmer, (around 2000 to 3000 Rs) and can come back to the city in 5-6 hours. The route midway is also one of its kind, because of the desert and will give you a new experience.

title: Battlefield recreated
review: Which Indian can forget the famous Bollywood film ‘Border’ based on the 1971 Longewala War between India and Pakistan ? Well, this is exactly the place where this war was fought, and to give a feel of the actual battlefield, most of the terrain has been left rugged as in the days of the war. The Indian tricolor proudly flutters and makes the visitor swell with pride. On display are the T-59 tank, guns, bunker, communication trench, jeeps, etc., which is sure to give the visitor goose-bumps. This is the last point upto which civilians are allowed and you can see the sentry guarding the road leading to the border.

title: Unusual but Must visit attraction
review: This attraction is located about 110-115 km from the city. Not many are aware of this and hence many miss visiting it. However its a must visit attraction if you want to understand how the 1971 battle of Longewala was fought. It reminds you of sacrifice, valour and courage of a few Jawans who fought the enemy who outnumbered them by a huge margin and yet won it. Its a symbol of Indian victory with some of the tanks used in war and captured by India. The location is the actual place where the battle was won.

title: iloveindia
review: best place  to enrich ur feeling towards nation n to remember the war of 1971,tanks jeeps bunker n BSF,love it

title: Excellent - Feel proud of their achiement
review: Do not miss this one! u may skip visiting one fort but keep this one in ur check list! Short movie and all the memories and defense equipments including some from pakistan are worth seeing

title: Goosebumps
review: If you are a simple once in a while patriot, this place will definitely give you the goosebumps. They have a few tanks/ammunition on display along with a small museum. The bunkers are also highlighted and there is a proper pathway between bunkers. They run a 20 min show on the battle of Longewala which is a must watch. The drive to Longewala in the middle of Thar is also awesome with great road within the desert.

title: Must visit place
review: I loved Spending time out here. The place is well preserved and maintained. Just 35 Kms from here is The famous Tanot Temple which also a must visit place.

title: awakes Indian in us
review: Its the place where war was fought, it awakes indian and pride in us, going here is real worth one must go salute to all indian soilder

title: A must visit place
review: This is a must visit place if you are planning a trip to Jaisalmer. The place fills us with patriotism and respect for our soldiers who defend our country.

title: Feel the Nation and its wounds here!
review: As I was heading to the place from the Tanot Temple, which it at an hour's drive, I could literally feel our Nation and a sense of patriotism that develops within is so strong, that.... is unexplained.

title: Must visit
review: The journey is very beautiful because of sand dunes on both sides of the road. One must nit miss this place.

title: Proud moment!!
review: Situated 15 kms from the longewala border. A small tribute to the longewala war in 1971. This place is a must visit. Not a very big museum and can be covered within 30 mins including a 10 min documentary. The Pakistani tank, 70's army jeep etc. Gives the proud feeling.

title: MUST visit
review: A war memorial for India Pakistan war of longewal.

title: India Pakistan war place
review: This is the place where India Pakistan taken place. Some tanks and other Pakistani tanks are kept here.

title: Great place to visit
review: Longewala war was fought in 1971. This is the place where the actual war took place. One can find captured pakistani tanks and other vehicles here.

title: Must Visit
review: 150 kms from Jaisalmer. Roads are very nice and scenic. Once there, you will realise the sacrifices of our soldiers.

title: It's Best
review: Longewala war museum is the best for visiting with family. All staff here very friendly and helpful. They provide all things very polite. Thanks.

title: A must visit if you are visiting Jaisalmer
review: Drive to this place was the highlight for our tour to Jaisalmer. You get to see a unique view of India and gives you a true picture of how diverse our country is. Long straight with sand dunes on both sides and small tiny villages of 8-10 houses. It's a different world. The memorial is also good. A small but awesome place. You can see couple of Pakistani captured tanks, a small documentary on the 1971 war that gives you goose bumps and you can feel the history of the war.

title: Visit to the land of Martyed
review: A must visit place to feel the sacrifices of the brave unsung heros who laid their life for the motherland. You can see the tanks the memorials the bunkers and now a days the are also showing a movie on 1971 war "Border" basically the war scene only and describe the war.

title: Worth making an effort to come and see
review: Well being as true Indian this place is something that you will love the most as this is witnesses famous battle between India and Pakistan.

title: Border Movie revisited
review: As a kid , grew up mouthing dialogues from the Border Movie along with my brother.

title: Memorable
review: One must visit this place and watch the short documentary about the 1971 war fought by our brave soldiers.

title: Real Story of Border Movie!!!! Longewala War Memorial.
review: Fantastic place to visit near Jaisalmer. Memories of the 1971 Indo Pak war. Few pakistani tanks and trucks are still there. Short movie about our brave soldiers also there. Ticket cost is 25 rupees per person. Overall fantastic experience. Must must visit.

title: Combine it with your visit to Tanot Mata temple
review: A short distance from Tanot Mata Temple this visit can be completed in ten to fifteen minutes.It has a small museum with the history and pictures of the 1971 war.Also displayed are Pakistani tankers captured during the war.A good place to visit for a slice of history of our country

title: The Tide turned here
review: This place has a checkered history. Indian Army turned the tide of the 1971 battle here. As sacred as a Temple for Soldiers.

title: Goosebumps
review: History of the place and the valor shown given the odds makes one bow one's head to the amazing sacrifices of the brave soldiers.

title: Jai mata di ! Border !
review: Site of longewala war on which movie 'Border' is based. it has the actual trenches and bunkers well preserved, even 2 pakistani tanks. suprised to know that all characters in border movie are real and even the story is mostly accurate. Very well maintained and run by indian army.

title: Good war memories
review: Good war memories with all details of the war. The memorial must be made a bit better just like Kargil memorial.

title: Goosebumps
review: This place gives you chill down the spine. Patriotism flows in the air here. This place gives you pride in the nation you belong and people who would died yesterday for our today and tomorrow.

title: Amizing
review: The longewala is the best place for visiting with friends. I would highilly recommended for everyone to see this palace.

title: WAR HEROES Memorial
review: Feeling BRAVE. It was a proud moment, realizing how our BRAVE SOLDIERS gave up their lives just to keep their Country's FLAG Safe.

title: Its A Temple For me....
review: Devotion and Action- meets here. It is a temple for me. I consider it  as a place where Patriotism takes a definite shape in our mind. You witness a place so grand -feel so proud. and understands meaning of service to the Nation. I felt so alive that i watched Border Movie with full excitement later. Sand-vast view-Open sky-Great fight of 4-5 Dec 1971. U became a part of it.

title: Must see in Jaisalmer!
review: I never loved reading history as much as I love seeing historic places. Longewala is one the major border post where the 1971 war happened ( if you remember the famous border movie, it was based on longewala war). The entire experience of walking through the bonkers, seeing the captured Pakistan tankers and talking to the jawaans was very special. It is a very nostalgic and patriotic experience which you should definately take back from jaisalmer!

title: A Must visit
review: Really gives you goose bumps when see the enemy Tanks and other vehicles and how our brave soldiers would have defended the mother nation.

title: Goosebumps and Patriotism
review: If you want to have goosebumps and tears in your eyes, must visit this place. At this place you would feel the patriotism at its peak. About this place, its the army post near the international boarder, deep inside the desert, where the battle of Longewala actually fought.  This Place is the battlefield of 1971 war on western front of India. Depicted in 1997 Movie BORDER. 15KM away from International border.

title: Must visit place in jaisalmer
review: if you will visit this place then you feel petroitic from inside as many pakistani tanks still there which belongs to 1972 war

title: Great warriors
review: Great place people should visit this place. People should carry their identity proof. Seeing short film  it’s charge ₹25/- you get all details in that.

title: Hero Monument of India : Must Visit.
review: In the cold heart of December 1971, a small, ill-equipped Indian Border Security Company decided to battle a fully armed and battle-ready Infantry plus Tanks divisions, and defeated them, throwing whatever they had at the enemy forces. Their tale of heroism is unbelievable and their victory is heart-warming. The Longewala War memorial is inspiring in extreme and it is duly thronged by Indians wanting to bring back a piece of luck and Inspiration from the place where the brave armed forces fought with such ferociousness and won.

title: Solemn, Respectful, Magnificent War Memorial
review: A memorial to commemorate one of the most gallantly fought battles and recount the chilling moments of valour and bravery of the soldiers of Indian armed forces at this very site.

title: Patrotism to the fullest
review: Really gives you goose bumbs, Live the history of the great jawans who fought to protect our motherland. Truly amazing

title: quick stopover at the memorial
review: the drive is completely worth it from Tanot Mata Mandir to the War Memorial and then back to Jaisalmer. The memorial is quite nice too, but not much to do.

title: Must Visit
review: A great place to visit, its a day trip from Jaisalmer can be done with Tanot Mata temple. Around 110 kms from Jaisalmer. Total trip including Tanot Mata temple would be around 260 kms, would need a taxi.

title: Get a patriotism high and a trip at this place
review: 100+ kms from jaisalmer city , longewala is 15kms from Indo Pak border post , and this war memorial will bring the memories of the 1971 war where Pakistan had crossed in 15kms from the border with their tanks and were defeated by the indian army and the airforce to retreat into their country .

title: must do
review: can get the understanding of the war front and can see the old tanker and bunker. A must do when in Jaisalmer. Also must see the temple close to longewala

title: A must visit place near Indo-Pak boarder in Jaisalmer
review: It is a memorial where Pakistani tanks captured by Indian Army during India-Pakistan war in 1971 are kept for display. A short documentary (patriotic) movie of about 20 minutes about the war is also screened for visitors. After visiting this place, I guarantee that a person will be filled from patriotism from body to soul, and will be proud on Indian Army. A well maintained place and must be visited in Jaisalmer.

title: good to know, how we are free and safe in our country!!!
review: displayed all facts and evidences of wars with Pakistan very well.

title: Longewala
review: To go to this side, you need a full day as the place is far off.  If you ran out of luck, nothing is there for your help. Do take a car who is in good condition.  You will be shown a short film on how Longewala battle was won by our Heroes! Feel proud of it!

title: Fire of patriotism
review: The movie Border made this place a household name so visiting it became a "must do". We drove up in our private car to Longewala from Jaisalmer and as we drew closer to the border post, the air did fill us with heavy patriotism. Needless to say, the security is top notch and our whereabouts were wired to the post from the moment we got ourselves registered in the town. The war memorial has all the tanks and artillery that were used/captured during the war. It is beyond comprehension how Maj Chandpuri catapulted the defence and shooed the enemy away.

title: Respect to the brave soldiers!
review: Nice place to spend 1-2 hours. There is a small hall where one can catch the documentary of the war and it's significant.  Salute to the martyrs and the soldiers protecting our borders.

title: All about 1971 War
review: This place gives so much information about the 1971 India Pakistan war at Longewala. Very nice to come here and feel proud.

title: Great drive from Tanot
review: About 38 Kms from Tanot, the road to this place passes through most beautiful desert landscape, even better than Jaisalmer-Tanot drive. The place itself has a Pakistani T-59 tank captured on display, plus some old pakistani vehicles lying in the desert. You need to register your vehicle before leaving the place. Foreign nationals are not allowed. Keep your ID and DL with you.

title: Great memorial
review: A great place where one can see the tanks and cars captured by Indian Army during the 1971 war at longewala. A place for true patriots

title: The war place of the brave Indian army
review: This is the place where the Indian army held the Pakistani troops that tried to invade in the night and also defeated them and sent them back. And experience less described in words and more felt in person.

title: A tribute to brave Indian soilders
review: Longewala memorial is the place where the actual war took place in 1971.This memorial is a remembrance of one of the most furious battles fought between India and Pakistan were  our brave 120 soldiers defended our country against full tank regiment of Pakistan. we can see the tanks and cars captured by Indian Army during the 1971 war.There is a small theater were they play 15 min movie on Longewala war..Every patriotic Indian should visit it.

title: Deserves More Than Five Rating
review: If you want to have goosebumps and tears in your eyes, must visit this place. At this place you would feel the patriotism at its peak. About this place, its the army post near the international boarder, deep inside the desert, where the battle of Longewala actually fought. The one which is shown in the Boarder movie. Do watch that movie before visiting this place. A few destroyed Pakistani tanks are still lying there in the sand. There a  15 mins movie is shown by army about the war and there is a war museum as well. You can have samosa, maggi, cold drink and other snacks there, which is absolutely unavailable in the nearby region due to desert. A must visit place. I love it.

title: Reminder of our history
review: Visiting Longewala post allowed me to briefly experience the work our armed forces for doing to keep us safe and secure. I also watched the small video featuring Longewala war. Overall I liked the post because of its outdoorsy nature and getting a glimpse of a piece of history.

title: Salute to bravery of our Indian Army
review: Right when you step here, feel proud of our Indian Army. This is the battlefield where our Army bravely fought and won.

title: A must visit place
review: If you are in jaisalmer take an extra day out to visit our army mens. This place is around 130Km away from the main city with the route taking you from the mid of the thar desert. Only BSNL works here so forget your phone for 4-5 Hrs. The route is simple beautiful with desert on the both side. On a safer side Make your vehicle tank full at ramgarh as you wont find any petrol pump. This area is under army so you should carry one of your id proof as well. For food you can taste maggie chole bhature made by army jawans in thier tent. Overall this place is fun with full of patrotic story of 120 Soldiers war heroes of 1971 Indo-Pak war

title: One should cover this
review: Whether you are patriotic or not, whether you are interested in war history or not but I will strongly recommend a visit to this place. The war memorial mostly covers the Indo-pak and Sino-India. Aprt from all the historic details and significance of these wars, it also throws light on various military equipment used, which is interesting. They also show an audio-visual short film about the war and war-heroes. Especially if you are travelling with kids, it is good way to build up their knowledge.

title: war musueam at border
review: only war musueam at jaisalmer it is near border 120 kilometer beautiful manage by Indian army must go ones

title: Must visit place in Jaisalmer
review: The place is aesthetically designed and maintained. Ambience is excellent. They screen a short documentary film also to the visitors which is also quite relevant.

title: Good War Memorial
review: Place is must visit on your Jaisalmer trip. The army personnel maintaining the place are extremely helpful and explain the battle of longewala and heroics of Indian army to tourists. There is also a video of 15 minutes which can be seen to understand the battle.

title: Felt Proud of our Indian Army
review: The battle of Longewala is one of the most defining moments of Indo-Pak 1971 war.Despite being heavily outnumbered by the Pakistani troops, the Indian Army through its bravery, shrewdness, and strategy won this battle.

title: Must visit for every Indian
review: The place where the war of 1971 was fought by a handful of brave Indian soldiers. There are displays of some of the tanks captured by the Indian army and various other artilleries used. I felt proud after listening to the story as narrated by one of the army men. Do reserve an hours time, they have an audio visual room where they show the same in form of a movie.

title: feel the army spirits
review: Had been to Longewala war museum and site. The men in command over there gave us an awesome treatment. This is were the war was  really fought in 1971 where the Pakistan Army came in all the to Longewala with an intention of reaching up to Jaisalmer. The movie shown depicts teh bravery of our great men who guarded us on the eventful night. This museum is not so great as the Jaisalmer one but this is were teh actual war happened.

title: Historic  war memorial
review: Though its bit  away  from Jaisalmer , its  worth  visiting  for  the  feel  of  1971 war. The story  ( also available in Audiovisual theatre ) make  you realise  the  Bravery & sacrifices  of Indian Soldiers & exemplary leadership . The  patriotism you feel in the  memorial is unique

title: Superb Place and Amazing Ride through the desert
review: Superb Place and Amazing Ride through the desert.

title: JAI HIND
review: You must Visit this Longewala War Memorial, there you can see pakistani tanks and other weapons, which captured during the 1971 war by our Army

title: pretty good for such a far away place
review: makes you feel patriotic... again. Well laid out of the war that happened. the audio visual is chargeable and can be missed

title: Longewala- Post-
review: CURRENT TEMPERATURE 45c approx. We enjoy a lot.

title: It ia Indian army all the way
review: Such a wonderful job done by the army.Every patriotic Indian should visit it.Also watch the audiovisual show.

title: A Real Time army Post
review: If you have watched the Movie " Border " This is real place where that war happened between India and Pakistan , Each one of the soldier fought till their last breath and won the war.

title: SIMPLY AMAZING !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: 1. Built By Army And Absolutely Cracker Of A Museum.

title: Longewala Visit
review: Recently visited Longewala while on a trip to Jaisalmer.  Visit to Longewala is must for all when in Jaisalmer.  Feeling while there in Longewala is entirely different and very mcuh patriotic.

title: A nice historical place
review: Visited the place with my son and cousins. Felt proud on our army men. A nice maintained place which reminds us the glory of that particular war day. My son was very excited.

title: Felt a sense of Pride visiting this place
review: Visited this place with a group of 12 friends and could so easily related to the masterpiece movie Border. Emotions were on a high when we visited this place and while viewing the Bunkers, Jeeps, Tanks the dialogues of the movie were on our lips. There was a sense of Proud within us when we visited this place. Must see the movie on Kuldeep Singh Chandpuri & how he fought the battle.

title: Historic Land`
review: One of the most historic places after independence for India. Visiting this place was always on cards because of the place karizma and made by the great movie BORDER.

title: Visit if you are interested
review: I visited this place, because I knew about the history of this place. How a handful of soldiers won a hard fought battle, simply because of their valour, grit and bravery. The captured tanks are on display there. The sight of the guns and tanks used in the battle, made me emotional. But, unfortunately I felt that, it could have been better maintained. Dirty urinals and and poorly managed canteen didn't do justice to such a place. They have a small documentary show also in a small auditorium. They charge only Rs25, for the entry. But wish they charged a bit more and showed a better one, than a reel, with most of it from the movie Border. Yet for my emotional connect I didn't mind going there. They can make it a better visitors place.

title: Be part of a historical war event
review: Is a must visit place if you are driving all the way to Tanot mata temple. However, please keep some time as it has multiple activities and absorb intensity of the battle, the bravery, and value of supreme sacrifices made by our soldiers. Do not miss to see the multimedia show - takes about 15 mins- which showcases the background of the war and how we defeated the enemy. It is long but beautiful drive between sand dunes, small villages and of course the feeling that you are going to be witness the history.

title: History Lover's delight
review: This is located about 125km away from Jaisalmer main city. We visited this place on the way back to Tanot Mata temple. This place is very close to Indo Pak Border. After 1971 Indo Pak war this battle ground turns into a war museum or you can say holly ground of Indian brave soldiers. It is a very emotional and heart touching place for all Indian. They also display a short film about the war

title: Excellent Place with Victorious History
review: This Place is very Proudfull for All the Indians, this is the Place where the Pakistanis Regiment were forced to move BackFoot in 1971 Longewala war, the BSF Jawans are always keen to explain you each and every facts of the longewala war. If you want to visit to Pakintan Border than you have to take a Prior permit for Jaisalmer Itself.

title: Jai Hind!!!
review: This place is on the way to Jaisalmer to Tanot, war memorial have good attraction tank and memorial.

title: Gotta go there to experience the thrill
review: Visiting the place after having watched movie border about 20 times was a dream come true for me. Tanks, Baracks, RCL guns, border pillar..everything had a story to tell there. Small movie show about the place and sovenier shop were also great. Place absolutely fills you with pride and patriotism.

title: 1971 War
review: Longewala is war memorial which is 19 km before India-Pak international border. This was the same place where brave Indian army fight against Pak largest army which was fully equipped with Tanks. Famous Bollywood movie "Border" was inspired and based on this war.

title: Loved this place than any other place in my life
review: This is one of the great war memorial places to visit. You have to plan before visiting Jaisalmer, because it is little far from Jaisalmer.

title: You would come to know what really happens during War
review: I was carried away once we reached to the location. It gives you a sense of patriotism feeling. As it takes back during the war and how our Indian Army bravely fought to save the country.

title: Emotional Patriotic and place of Pride
review: Its a place of historic importance and place of pride as Indian Air Force along with Army thrashed Pakistan Army with biggest ever defeat. The importance of this place becomes even more prominent after Sunny Deol's movie Border on the historic battle  of Longewal. Indian Air Force has proved the worth of Air Power

title: Fill With Pride
review: Longewala is the place where the war of 1971 between India took place. Border is 15 Km from this location. The memorial is the place where the actual war took place in 1971. Our brave 120 soldiers defended our country against full tank regiment (90 tanks) of pakistan. This place have a AV room here they have prepared a short clip related to the 1971 war.

title: A real war memorial
review: Longewala war memorial is one of the few war memorials in the world, which are located right at the place where a battle was fought. This memorial is a remembrance of one of the most furious battles fought between India and Pakistan. This battle has a special place in the history of Indian armed forces, and that makes this place to be a must visit for every Indian national. Do not miss the video documentary.

title: Overwhelming reminder of the '71 War
review: Battleground of the India-Pak '71 War; reminder of the heroics of the Indian Army. The museum has Pak tanks that had entered Indian territory. There's a small film that they play, it moves you to tears when you watch the bravery displayed by the Indian soldiers, prepared to defend their posts until death.

title: Inspirational Location of an Epic Battle of 1971
review: This Museum is a small but well managed one and it depicts the Guts and Glory of the Indian Army in 1971 War and also the role played by the Indian Air Force in salvaging a situation that would well have gone adverse. It has a small amphitheater which showcases the valour as a movie and a Souvenir Shop too, with basic toilet amenity. It has a small collection of War Trophies and does inspire the young and old alike and evokes great Pride in our Armed Forces.

title: A  Tribute to Brave India Soldiers.
review: This Memorial is built to commemorate famous battle of Longewala in which a handful of India soldiers under the command of Maj. Chandpuri destroyed the fully mechanised battalion of Pakistan Army. The memorial is well kept by Army. It has a small cafe. However the choice of menu is limited, as this is quite away from any city, so a better eating facility will be icing on the cake

title: Must visit place
review: We went driving to jaisalmer & on the way back decided to detour & visit tanot temble & war memorial. We were surprised that this was crowded asserting the fact that this is a famous place.

title: @Proud to be Indian
review: A place must to be visit if you are in Jaisalmer ,2 hours drive from Jaisalmer town .This is a place which would really make all Indian proud of their Indian Army.You can actually recall how bravely our soldiers fought that day.

title: A place where you feel bravery! Amazing
review: At this place only 120 Indian soldiers destroy 90 tanks of Pakistan and stoped paki army to enter in Indian border. Amazing place to visit.

title: Brilliant war memorial
review: it takes around 1.5 hour from Jaisalmer one way. Its an excellent war memorial which talks about the Longewala war of 71. they have preserved the tanks and actual war tunnels well. Make sure youc arry ample food and water on your trip as you wouldnt find much on the way.

title: Well Maintained Museum near Border
review: it is located just 15 kms away from India Pak border. It is the last place before border where one can travel without permit. Beyond this point its entirely BSF area where you need permit to enter.

title: Must see palce
review: Its an off beat place but you can plan your visit to this place while returning from the Tanot. the road to this place is worth traveling if you love rusty nature.

title: Thanks to soldiers
review: This place will bring goosebumps to all Indians when the documentary about longewala post is played.The place is well maintained with display of Pakistani tanks captured in war and boards explaining the bravery of Indian defense forces. The place is a long drive from Jaisalmer.

title: Must Visit Place....
review: Gives a very patriotic feeling when you visit this place. Very nice and well maintained. Must visit place if you are travelling to Jaisalmer.

title: 1971 revisited
review: its a place to remember the soldiers of indian army who have lost their lives during the war with the pakistan.

title: Laongewala war memorial
review: Longewala war memorial is a muesum which have stored history of laongewala war..meny unexploded  bomb shell and old miltey stuff all..must come

title: The Memoirs of a Great Victory!
review: If planning to do 3 things in Jaisalmer, taking out time and driving around 100 mins to Longewala is a worth option. Only a true Indian would make sense of these words

title: Jai Hind - Place of Victory
review: Salute to the Jawans who sacrificed their life protecting the nation and to the Jawans who stand straight protecting the borders.

title: This will tickle your patriotic nerve for sure
review: Imagine how would you feel standing on the ground where our soldiers and martyrs defeated Pakistan in the 1971’s Longewala war? This place is barely 15 Kms away from Pakistan border. The war posts and the destroyed Pakistani tanks and vehicles are still preserved. You can actually see a blown up Pakistani tank and truck. The setup of the "Border Movie" is almost accurate to this actual war spot.

title: Historical war memorial
review: It takes 2 hrs from Jaisalmer to reach this historical war memorial. Indeed, this place is less crowded and silent. The militants shows 20 minutes documentary film about the 1971 war with Pakistan and the way India achieved victory. This place showcase the battle remains of Pakistan's tanks. Longewala war memorial is a must sightseeing plan in Jaisalmer trip. The militants are remembered and recognised for their sacrifice and patriotism!

title: Must day trip
review: It is around 115 km from Jaisalmer....glory of Indian Army....you will see Pakisthani Jeep,Tanks.....good to see as a patriotic

title: Glory of Indian Army
review: This place is about 120 kms away from Jaisalmer. The destroyed Pakistani tanks & army vehicles reminded us the tell of our brave soldiers. The place will definitely take you back time to the Longewala war. A proud place for an Indian.

title: A poignant reminder
review: This place is well worth the travel from Jaisalmer! It gives goosebumps soaking in the significance of what happened at that place in 1971 when a small band of soldiers without one armoured jeep managed to hold a line of Pakistani tanks for a whole night. It is our duty to not forget those brave soldiers who laid down their lives and this memorial is a way to keep their memory alive. The Pakistani tanks that were captured or left behind provide an additional point of attraction.

title: A tribute to our Army
review: The place is situated about 110 Km from Jaisalmer on Pakistan border.

title: Do or Die Battle - how handful of Indian soldiers made history by proving their mettle!!!!!!!!!!!
review: Longewal post just 15 kms. From Indo Pak border was raided by Pakistani army in December, 1971 with full force of 45 tanks and 2000 soldiers and there were only 120 soldiers to defend the post.

title: Historic and Patriotic Location
review: This area was witness to a real heroic battle between Indian and Pakistani forces. Many of the Bravehearts were martyred but not before inflicting a severe damage to the enemy tanks and army. A hindi moview 'Border' is based on this actual battle.

title: Nice reminder of the army's achievements
review: The 2 tanks and some arms captured from the invading Pakistani forces are displayed here. There is also a 15 minute documentary on the war being played at regular intervals. While it does make you proud of the Indian army's accomplishments in the war, the long ride to get there makes it disappointing as there is little else other than the displays mentioned above.

title: Longewala War Memorial: Pride of Jawans
review: Patriots definitely feel thrilled here. However, the Movie Show contains some small historical facts probably made long back, needs editing, additions, deletions of the current affairs also, to impress upcoming youngsters. Jawans of Madras Regiment provides excellent authentic South Indian Recipe.

title: Worth visiting
review: People having love for country and its brave mens gaurding the country must visit the place and must see in details the war history of 1971. I salute my countrymen for their bravery.

title: You must see this place
review: It's a historic place where in 1971 Pak tried to invade n few Indian soldiers made them run for life. Some tanks, ammunitions, accessories etc captured during that time are kept for public viewing. Spend one whole day there n was still not satisfied.  The short movie is good but is more of a part of movie Border. Jai Hind.

title: Remembering the fallen heroes!!!
review: I visited this heroic land on 9th Feb 2017 where Indian soldiers defended the honor of the country against Pakistan.

title: Longewala War Memorial - A must see
review: The 38 kms drive from Tanot to Longewala through the desert is a great one. The best part is  once you reach Longewala, starting with milestone 638 to the war memorial to the captured tanks to the audio visual film are all a must see. This gave me goose pimples seeing how the jawans off the Indian Army live in very harsh and inhospitable conditions to make our lives safe. My salute to them,

title: A Must Visit
review: This memorial is a must visit for all the citizens of india, in order to know the history behind a great invasion fiasco that happened for pakistan when they tried to enter into the territories of india through northwest border or rajasthan (jaisalmer) and it was the indian army which stood victorious and crucifying the pakistani army and didnt let them have what they had come for.

title: Best thing to do
review: If you are going to jaisalmer than must plan a drive to laungewala.. its a breath takin experience and you wint regret

title: Real feeling of "Border" - Actual and movie as well..
review: Its more than 100 km away from jaisalmer and surely to cover alongwith Tanot mata temple visit. Both will take full day trip from jaisalmer... It has on display the tanks and other warfare vehicles of Pak army captured during Ind-Pak war.. Also, has actual bunkers which you can go inside ... The highlight of the place is variety of punchlines, infamous Army saying on display giving most authentic feeling...

title: MUST, must visit!
review: How many time in your life will you get an opportunity to thank the Indian army personally? Do it here!

title: Patriotsm at its best relive BORDER
review: An excellent place to experience the history of indian armed forces and what they did for us citizens

title: Tear-jerker
review: If you're a history buff like I am, Longewala would bring tears to your eyes. Army has done a great job of creating and maintaining this showcase of 1971 Indo-Pak war at Longewala. An elaborate hall is full of memorabilia from that era, helmets, holsters, ID Cards etc. On the walls one can read about the war in great detail. The valor of our troops in face of great adversity is something that fills your heart with pride. An AV room next door plays a 20 minute film with excerpts from the movie Border to show us the details of that fateful night. The captured tanks and armoured vehicles belonging to Pakistan strewn across the desert make for a surreal sight.

title: A Must Visit Place near Jaisalmer.
review: The each and every part of this place describes the sacrifice and gallant of Indian Soldiers. The victorious stories of the Indo Pak war at this Border is well described by the seized Pak tanks. The whole story of the battle of Longewala is being narrated there in visual form by playing a video at the small theatre room, which is anchored by Actor Kabir Bedi. The place is a must visit for people visiting Jaisalmer.

title: Mesmerising....
review: A place must visit....cannot be expressed in words... Go and see for yourself.. Make sure you plan tanaut temple and Longewala both.

title: desert all around makes it special
review: bikers, dont miss this place. the drive from tanot to here is nothing short of an awakening, no traffic at all, just some settlements of nomads, no sign of modernisation, this ride is sure to make u happy.

title: Visit to the History...
review: You all must be aware of the 1971 war.. This War memorial is dedicated to all those brave soldiers who fought for our country valiantly.. It is said that when Laungewala post was attacked the Indian army was heavily outnumbered, nevertheless the Indian Army proved to be a force to reckon with.. The memorial here is a nice reminiscent of the historical battle, right in the middle of the desert and close to the border.. The two enemy tanks destroyed are still placed here.. you can also see the bunkers, recoilless rifles.. This place is a must visit.. 100 odd kms from Jaisalmer.. Salute to the Indian Soldiers!!

title: If you didn't visit this place , your jaisalmer trip is a waste .. MUST GO
review: Best place to visit ,

title: must go to longewala if you visit jaiselmer
review: it is the place where battle of indo-pak war 1971 happened. pakistani tanks and other items where kept there. bunkers and tunnel are also there. it takes one day trip from jaiselmer-tanot-longewala-badabagh-jaiselmer. from tanot it is half an hour away.

title: It is a must if you love biking.
review: The war memorial is a nice place to spend some quite time. You feel a sense of pride when you read about the war and the sacrifices made by our jawans to defend our borders. One of the highlights for me was the biking experience from Jaisalmer to Longewala. We rented a Royal Enfield and started early morning. The roads and the terrain are mesmerizing and make for a perfect biking trip.

title: very nice place to visit
review: Its very nice place to visit after watching amazing palace and sam dessert. Its very different place which is describe the story of war with pakistan. Indian soldiers bravery, war instruments and all. Must visit by every indian.

title: Proud of our Army
review: Nothing provokes sense of patriotism more than visiting this place. Real war tanks left behind by pakistani army men. Details of how we lost our brave men.... Great efforts made to preserve the location as it is. Excellent place to visit. also the route is worth travelling

title: Must visit
review: Amazing place, truly a must visit if you are in Rajasthan. Truly relived the history there and it was great to see how braver soldiers fought for our safety in tough conditions. Jai Hind!!!

title: A Great Tribute
review: We really would have missed something had we not visited the place. We were on our way back to Jodhpur and I thought we would just take a round but the amazingly frendly behaviour of the armymen at the entrance and the spectacularly clean surrounding made us change our minds. Once in the halls we just could not move off in a hurry. We wanted to read every bit of the details about the glorious victories of our army. Stories of the sacrifices of so many young men brought tears. The 15 minutes video about the wars brought goosebumps.

title: Must visit to admire history....
review: Now they have developed area by restoring old tanks and jeeps and also displayed history of battle.  also showing short film of 71 war.

title: You need to experience this !
review: We drove down from Jaisalmer to Longewala, started around 9am. It's about a 2 hour drive with very few patches of habitation - carry water and some eatables with you. The roads are decent throughout, watch out for stray animals and steep curves that come left fielded - recommend maintaining steady speeds of 60-80kmph.

title: Reminder to Indians who their Soldiers Guard them!
review: Loved visiting the place as we have been dreaming to be there for long. This is a place where Indian soldiers defeated Pakis. I am a proud Indian and loved visiting like a holy place.

title: Excellent Experience
review: Really amazed with things kept there. Also came to know difficulties our solders faced during war. Must visit if you are true Indian

title: Very fascinating site near pak border and in middle of desert
review: This location is in middle of desert and in middle of jaiselmair – tanot road. Its martyar memorial prestigious place. U can see pakistani defeated tanks scatered around. Important thing to know you will loose mobile connectivity once you cross Ramgarh if you are using a private telecom operator. However upon reaching "Longewala" you will get connectivity only if you are maintaining BSNL postpaid connection, all remaining private operators prepaid and postpaid connections will remain off. Ahead to longewala few kms after Tanot mata mandir comes there also private telecom operator s connections remain shut due to security reasons. However here too you will get connectivity if you are maintaining a BSNL postpaid connection

title: Speechless
review: You can actually walk in the bunker, climb over the enemy's abandoned tanks few of which are still stationed in the desert as it is. You'll surely be reminded of the movie - BORDER. The very place the fight happened and the very place where the movie was shot. The actual border is now pretty far away form here and is not accessible to civilians at all.

title: Jai Hind Jai Bharat!!
review: Must visit place.. war site of 1971 war..same which was shown in Movie "Border".. on this check post Pakistani army attacked with tanks and Indian soldier ( 120 soldiers) defeated them and destroyed their tanks.. also captured some as memory.. you can sit inside a tank as well and get yourself click.. 120 km from sam and 10-12 km from tanot..

title: Jai Hind
review: It's a must visit place, the pakistani tanks and trucks that we capture during 1971 war are there , it really feel proud to watch the place where our brave Army beat the Pakistani bastards and there so called Tanks !

title: Every Indian should visit once
review: All Indians should definitely visit this place once in their lifetime. proud of what our army has done for the nation. Hats off!

title: good place
review: longewala is one place from where we can see pakistan border.but the army allow up to one point . for crosiing that point we need to take prior permission from army headquators.

title: Patriotism at its Best
review: Great place to visit incase you plan to relive history or are interested in getting to understand war situationsbetter. Would also recommend this place to anyone wanting to instill an understanding of patriotism in their children.

title: Emotional visit of valour
review: All Indians must visit places such as laungewala. Childen must also be taken to understamd the intensity and the courage of the work done by our Armed Forces

title: A must visit place.
review: Its around 2 hrs drive from Jaisalmer city. Don't forget to get a pass issued from BSF office Jaisalmer if you are willing to visit the border area. The don't allow you to go beyond Tanot post/temple if you don't have the pass. Its a good chance to visit border area - approach for the pass from BSF office 1 or 2 days in advance when you a plan to visit the Longewala/Tanot area. This pass is only required if you are planning to visit border area.

title: Must see museum.
review: Just visit the museum and be proud of your country and soldiers.

title: Cherish the heroism
review: It was awesome to experience the war area and learn more about hero's of 1971 war. The area was very well maintained and you get to see the Pakistani tanks, Indian bunkers, and Border pillar. Must visit.

title: Being at the War-Site!
review: If you visited Jaisalmer, it's must to visit Longewala war museum. It is maintained by BSF.

title: Tribute to our Bravehearts
review: It is a great and heart moving depiction of the Battle of Longewal . The night time battle with the enemy comes alive through the displays and the models made there . Also the fact that you are barely 15 - 20 kms form the international Border gives you goosebumps . A absolute Must See experience when in Jaisalmer

title: Maa Tujhe Salaam!
review: It feels amazing, driving through the non-touristy areas beyond the Sam Sand dunes, as if one is in a movie. Huge Sand Dunes on the left and right side of the road and a beautiful long road, made by the border-rods organisation with beautiful quotes guides you from Jaisalmer to Longevala.

title: Gave me Goose Bumps !
review: After a scenic ride on a road going up and down like a slide , reaching this peaceful war memorial is a motivating patriotic moment .There is a small cafe and a movie room where they show patriotic films.The army men on duty are cordial and helpful. The inspiring quotes from poetry spread all over on stone plates give you goose bumps. I loved the place .

title: Ode to the Battle of Longewala
review: This Memorial pays tribute to the famous battle which quite dramatically altered the fate of the 1965 war.....has tanks and vehicles used in the battle and a small auditorium to screen a short film on the battle..tea and snacks available...is 42 km from Ramgarh which is about an hours drive from Jaisalmer

title: patriotic bonding
review: love for ur country make u go this place. Great Achievements by Indian army  you feel privileged and proud of Indian army achievement and sacrifices by our soldiers.

title: Excellent Museum
review: This war museum has collection of real tanks that Indian army won in the battle.

title: Awesome....!!
review: A must visit place.

title: Dedicated to our victory
review: Its almost 100 KM from jaisalmer and take around half a day to cover logewala and tanot mata. Carry food and water.

title: place of Nation's pride!
review: excellent place which is bestowed with the sense of national pride. The road conditions are good and scenic beauty enroute is mesmerizing.

title: Outstanding place
review: Great and historic spot to visit. Loved the desert landscape. This place is just a few km from Pakistani border.

title: longewala
review: not as expected but there is a temple there which is actually very famous due to the war. Tanot mata temple

title: A deep insight in the war history of India-pakistan.
review: This is a great collection of War Memorials and Stories of our great soldiers. A must visit for all civilians to get an insight into Indian Army and Its great history.

title: India's Modern Day 'Thermopylae'
review: Border camp of Longewala, made famous by the Bollywood movie 'Border' is really a inspiring place for not only Indians by anyone who believes in courage beyond call of duty.

title: The Bravery Place !!
review: Suddenly the air fills with the patriotism as you will see the war memorial and remains of Indo-Pak famous war Boarder movie is based upon. The overall atmosphere is incredible. It also gives us the opportunity to feel and sense the tough situation and climate our brave Soldiers are living in to safeguard us and our country.

title: Excellent WAR MUSEUM along with BSF POST
review: This place is near from international border of India & Pakistan so every Indian tourist very exited for visit because during 1971 war only near by 120 soldier fights with Pakistan's tank regiment (T-90 type) & win & stopped them.

title: A must see war memorial
review: A visit to Longewala and Tanot is a must if you visit Jaisalmer. Tanot is the farthest end of WEstern India that a civilian can go. There is temple there. ON your way back from Tanot check out the Loungewala post. A very humbling experience. This is where the 1971 attack happened And the Indian armed forces defended the border. Thanks to them India is what it is today.  Border, hindi movie is based on this true story.they even play a visual for people who do not know the significance of Loungewala. Lot of bunkers set up to get the feel of it.A truly humbling experience. Salute to the armed forces. We are proud of you.

title: Awesome War Museum
review: A must visit place when you visit Jaisalmer even if it's 120 odd Kms away from city. This is a master idea by the Indian Army to recreate the War of 1971. It's a great feeling when you take a pic at Pakistani tanks and guns. Don't miss visiting this place.

title: border visit
review: To see the abandon weapon of neighbor country I'm just amazed, and what a response given by our brave soldier's. A never forget visit of my life.

title: A must visit place for every Indian!
review: I just can't explain how amazing it feels at Longewala. I am really short of words for it. The bunkers, the seized tanks of Pakistan army, etc. I was just getting the goosebumps over there!!!!!!

title: Very near to our border
review: Must visit place. One will see actual longewala post where the war was fought. All locations are marked which will give you the idea about the history. Must watch the movie that they will show.

title: worth visiting
review: who can forget the legendary border movie. Well this place will give you a nice feel of the movie and the war that happened at this place. you can walk through the army bunkers which have trenches between them and see the captured tanks

title: A must visit place
review: If you are in jaisalmer, before ging for sand dunes, you can visit this place. It is worth visiting. Feel the wind of border, tanks seized during indo-pak war, documentary on war with pakistan and so on..

title: जय हिंद। जय भारत।
review: Must visit place for a true patriotic person.

title: Very interesting!
review: Wonderfully done in memory of all the brave soldiers who made the ultimate sacrifice! There is a 25 min AV which helps set context of the war and what happened at Longewala.. Must visit as a mark of respect..

title: Feel Proud to be an Indian-----Salute to all those Brave Souls
review: A must visit for all Indians.

title: Indians will not miss this great place
review: I reached this place @ 42 deg C and could not stand the heat. But when I saw the charmful India Army men and imagined their life, I really knew that I am honored to have visited here. The Pakistan army tanks captured during the 1971 war and a short Video on the 1971 war (25 INR entry ticket) will really make you proud.

title: Freaking awesome place for army fans..
