review: This is the place that every army fan n patriot need to visit...it is around 50-60km from tanot Mata temple..you can see all the tanks, jeeps n buses that were captured during the Indo-pak war....they even have the bunker that were used during that time...and u will get goosebumps once u enter any of them..and will realise what army goes thru in there daily life routine..u can also watch a movie of 15 mins (for which they charge 25rs..its Ok..worth..for Army fan it's nothing)..there is a WELL in which Pakis mixed poison to kill Indian army as it was the only source for Indian army for water....

title: Re-living History
review: A must do when in Jaisalmer- The Longewala War Memorial is re-living history! The patriotic fervor and the adreline rush is a life time and unique experience.

title: True Valour experienced first hand
review: This is a must visit. The valour of Indian soldiers can be sensed just by walking around the grounds and seeing the actual trenches and bunkers where the soldiers fought during that night. Pakistani tanks and armoured vehicles destroyed that night are also on display - enough to give one goosebumps.

title: Jaisalmer Trip
review: Jaisalmer is nothing if u hv nt visited the war memorial. It gives u goose bumps n extreme pride of our soldiers. Jaisalmer is more than havelis n desert safari. Trip is incomplete if u hv bt visited longewala n Tanot Mata mandir. We must appreciate our soldiers how they r guarding our country in such a deserted area. Salute n Respect.

title: Feel of Reality ....
review: A fantastic place which shows Glory of Indo Pak Battle. Indian army is managing this Museum and anybody can visit here without getting permission.

title: Must go place
review: You will feel patriotic when you visit this place and you get to know more about the battle of longewala.

title: Feel the power of determination and patriotism
review: Longewalan war memorial is one of the must visit place around Jaisalmer.

title: glory of Indian army.
review: this memorial show us the glory on Indian army.few Indian solders face thousands of Pakistani solders and Indian army get glory,

title: good to see as a patriotic
review: There are many things to see here

title: Battlefield Longewala visit
review: On my journey to Jaislmer, Rajasthan, our another halt which we decided is Longewala, The great battlefield where our Army defeated the Pakistani Army.

title: Must visit place
review: This place is famous for 1971 battle of india and pakistan. Where 120 indian soldiers fought bravely with more than 600 pakistani soldiers and won it. Now indian army has developed this place like a open Museum where  destroyed pakistani tanks lying in sand . indian army soldiers work as guide and tell all the history of this place. One theatre is also there where indian army shows a short movie about sacrifices indian soldiers have made to protect india from enemies. A must visit place. Salute to indian army. Jai hind.

title: Great memories of our army peoples
review: Historical place and here we get to know about our brave army that they are always ready for anything without thinking about their own life or anything elas. All they want is to save our country and country people from enemy

title: MUST VISIT
review: Very Good place, infarct I would say best place to visit in Jaiselmer.

title: Light on Indian Army's Heroics
review: The memorial has been established to remember the bravery and victory of Indian army over Pakistani army in 1971.The Pakistani tanks and war weapons captured are displayed.There is a theater where Longewala war film is screened for the visitors.

title: Thrilling
review: feels awesome to see a place so sacred to soldiers, a war which created history, soldiers are so friendly and explains everything with enthusiasm....big salute

title: Very nice must watch
review: Its must watch,  so many war memorial keep there  15 minute docomenty film also there play  , must take guide only 100 rs

title: Longewala war Memorial
review: Visit to this place was really wonderful.  BSF jawans guide you and explain about the 1971 war.  A short film in mini theatre was very knowlegeable.  The area is well kept and very clean and neat.  After watching film we feel very proud to be Indians and will definitely start respecting our Jawans.  I feel very lucky as I could visit such a place.

title: Must visit for every Indian
review: This war memorial is made at the actual war site. The bunkers, tanks used then are still kept at the actual site of the battle.

title: Must visit for every Indian
review: Being the actual site of India-Pakistan 1971 war, this place has absolute patriotic feel to it. The army people tell you as many things as they can.

title: Must visit
review: An awesome experience of reviving the memories of one of the great stories of the brave jawans of Indian Army. How the attack happened, who all were there and how did they manage to defeat the tank regiment. This place has answer to all these questions and more. You also get to interact with jawans currently stationed there and understand their life a little more.

title: Memorial to Indian Victory in Indo-pak war of 1971.
review: In addition to the 15 mins film on the war, ironically inspired by the Bollywood movie Border, you can see the actual bunkers, trenches, and some captured paki tanks. The best thing is you can stand on those tank, and feel a little of that paki tank crush under your feet.

title: MUST SEE PLACE AT JAISALMER
review: No words are there to express our patriotic feelings.. Awesome experience... Great salute to our soldiers

title: Dont Miss it if you are in jaisalmer
review: Dont Miss it if you are in jaisalmer. Old tanks and the museum all speak loud the bravery and sacrifice of our soldiers.

title: Patriotism is what you will feel here
review: The place where 71' war between India and Pak happened, the Indian army has a couple of captured Pak tanks displayed here, a memorial and a show on the war. There is also a border pillar kept here which Pak took from border and brought it here, after which they were stopped from advancing further by our army. Definitely a visit when you go to Jaisalmer to pay a tribute to the brave soldiers who guard us day and night.

title: Definitely worth visiting
review: We learnt about the museum during our visit to Gadisar lake and decided to visit. It is definitely worth visiting for anyone who is interested in military history.

title: Should visit....
review: The place is worth visiting to witness what our soldiers sacrificed for us.The drive specially is beautiful with good roads.

title: An Open War Museum
review: It's nice effort to keep our past and sacrifice of our solders alive.

title: Nostalgic
review: This is a must visit place at Jaisalmer and am glad we went there. Its inspirational to see the place and learn about the history. The Pakistan tanks captured are on display.

title: Valour of Indian Army
review: This makes any Indian proud when India stopped the marching Pakistan army at this place. Sheer courage by our soldiers which was reflected in Hindi movie Border.

title: rush of patriotism
review: you feel the rush of patriotism while being in this place. while seeing the weaponry and sandbag bunkers you start correlating the scenes from border movie. This place is not located on the exact border but inside few kilometers from it. The place also makes you realize the fact that the kind of hostile conditions our solders go through while protecting our boarders. Journey till the place is also rewarding, you get to see the long empty roads going through the barren desert. There is no special permission needed to visit the place however you are requested  to show an ID proof to the solder maintaining the visitor's list. overall road condition is very good, however there is a patch of approx. 10 kms between Ramgarh and Tanot Temple,where there is no road and BRO work is going on. With my experience one should visit Longewala first then Tanot and retreat through the same way. There is a small cafeteria and small theater to see the story behind the war. I visited the place on the rented bike with my friend and the cold we had to face on the way was 2-3 times of the Jaisalmer city so add the additional layers before starting.

title: must visit place
review: very patriotic , pakistani tanks and trucks are on display and tourists can get themeselves photographned......place is very neatly kept by BSF.................. you also get wonderfull idli sambar just at the parking lot...............one can enjoy a short movie for 25 rupees giving a background of how the entire war was started and finished........slighlt away from the city and sam dunes but my recommendation to do it..

title: A must visit
review: This is a must visit place for any indian.The war memorial showcases the efforts and accessories used in the Indo-Pak war of 1971 and is exemplary of our country's jawans brilliance and tactical mindset.Here one can see the actual weaponry and tactics deployed by the Indian armed forces to foil enemy's attack.Worth visiting.

title: Very Patriotic
review: Good to see the bunkers and tunnel where our soldiers fought.pakistan tanks are on display in this war memorial.You can see a movie also showing the fight of our soldiers.

title: A place which will fill your eyes with tears when you read about the sacrifices at the longewala battle
review: We won the battle and the war but lost a lot of brothers there - its a place where your heart will salute our defense personnels

title: Great reminder of the war
review: It is well maintained with maps and details about the longewala war. You also get to see the bunkers and trenches used by the soldiers. Even kids will have fun in the trenches and playing in the jeeps and tanks that are displayed.

title: Patriotic Place
review: You must read information about the place before you visit.

title: Must Visit for all Indians
review: You can visit Jaisalmer only for this memorial.

title: Visiting the history happened at the border
review: Good place to see in the winters (preferably) nearly 110-140kms from the city. Have the display of the Pakistani tanks & Jeeps which they have left behind. Have an Audi-Visual set up which demonstrates the events happened during the war time in 1971.

title: Sense of pride
review: The remote place, located not too far from the border, gives you a sense of pride of winning a war and same time reminds about the sacrifices made by the soldiers. There is a nice display of tanks, rifle, jeeps, bunkers and you can touch and feel them, go around them. You can watch a short war movie in the Audio Visual Theatre or visit a photo gallery to get a glimpse of the war.

title: Must Visit
review: Visit this place to experience the history of 1971 war with Pakistan.This place is around 40 kms from Tanot mata temple, Indian army and BSF are taking care of this place. There is no entry fee, one just need to prove his identity.Pakistani tanks & jeeps which were captured during the war are on display along with INDIAN bunker and other weapons. There is an army canteen there but you will not find much to eat so carry your food with you. You can also experience a 15 mins movie for a nominal fee (the same movie is played in Jaisalmer war memorial).

title: Loved visiting this Historic Place
review: Away from Jaisalmer, about 15 KMS away from Pakistan border is this Longewala War memorial where one can see the capsized Tanks of Pakistan, bunkers etc. The defense personal guide the visitors very well. Advised to carry a valid Government Issued Photo Identity Card as its a sensitive area.

title: Not a place to be missed!
review: If you are traveling to Jaisalmer, take a day out and do surely visit this memorial.

title: Must visit if you go to Jaisalmer
review: It was a battle field.  About a couple of hours of drive from Jaisalmer.  The route was picturesque.  We went their on bikes (Royal Enfields suggested).  Don't miss the video show, although I found it not so interesting.  It's played in Hindi (I don't remember having seen subtitles) so if you're a foreigner, you may want to skip it.  There are real Pakistani tanks and military trucks (maintained).  Just less than a kilometer from here on the way to Tanot, there are sand dunes.  Stop by, and take a walk on them.  The view is picturesque.

title: A tribute to our soldiers
review: Place is very well maintained. Has a photo gallery and an option for a short movie viewing to depict the story of 71 war.

title: Don't Miss It
review: Longewala War memorial is a memorial which will relive the 1971 war for you. Indian army manages the Memorial and this is the place to be. Located at a distance of around 120 kms from Jaisalmer, 40 kms from Ramgarh and 40 kms from Tanot, this place will not disappoint you for sure. Various War machines like tanks, trucks, mortars, jeeps, bunkers etc are preserved here very nicely by the Indian army. You can take photographs with them, you can climb the tanks, ride the Jeeps and hide in the bunkers here only which is otherwise impossible for a layman. They show some movie also which is free for the serviceman and chargeable for the layman.

title: Braveheart!
review: An awesome place for all Indians to visit who want to get up close to the border and see the battle field of 1971 war. A place that the movie "border" brought into focus. It's a fair drive from Jaisalmer but worth it. You get to see couple of captured tanks and get the feel of a war field. On way open desert with no connectivity with civilisation. Carry food and water and make sure have fuel in your vehicle.

title: Worth Visit
review: We went there on our return trip from Tanot Mata Temple and found it very interesting .It is nicely maintained and worth visit. The BSF personnel posted therewere very courteous and helpful.

title: The best place to pay tribute to heroic martyrs
review: This place is full of patriotic ambiance. While not as glamorous as Wagah border, but has more historic significance. Thoroughly loved how well it is managed. Jai Hind.

title: Salute to the war heroes
review: This is the actual battleground of 1971 war !

title: Excellent place to visit
review: KIds and us really enjoyed this place. Very well adorned and marked out by the Army. You can understand the entire sequence of events that took place in 1971 during the Longewala war. Must visit

title: A Must Visit place near jaisalmer
review: We visited this war memorial along with Tanot temple. Well maintained memorial by the army. A short film about the Laungewala war is shown for 25 Rs. Nice display of captured tanks of Pakistan army. Heart fills with proud and joy after learning about the valor and sacrifice which our defence forces make for us.

title: Inspirational
review: A memorial to the 1971 battle of Longewala, this place recreates some of the scenes and that conflict and displays military hardware too. Easily accessible by road and especially so when visiting Tanot temple.

title: Salute And Respect
review: The place is basically a 1971 Indo Pak war memorial which is recreated and maintained to give you the actually feel of the war field. The Indian Soldiers there welcomes you and explains you that part of history where you will surely Salute the Indian Army for protecting civilians who least bothers about these great Heroes. A must visit place during your Jaisalmer trip even if it costs you 1 more day.

title: A Must Visit Place
review: Visited this place during Oct 2015.

title: Amazing heroism
review: It's a story not many can even imagine. The ultimate saga of heroism. A place where one of the most decisive battles were fought. This memorial recreates the memories of the battle. Beautifully made it shows how close the enemy was in that battle. There is a small movie shown on the battle. The place also has a cafe for refreshments.

title: Will give you goosebumps
review: You can go back in time and visualize how 120 people were able to stop a full battalion. Amazing stuff from army, all in all this is a must visit place , very well maintained .Its nearby Tanot temple so you can plan for both of them . They also show you a movie of around 20 minutes on chargeable basis which can take you back down the memory lane.

title: Good maintained memories
review: This place shows the symbols of the Indian victory over Pakistan in 1971 war. It's maintained well by Indian army. Indo-Pak border is just 15/km from here.Tanks ,guns and vehicles are shown here .You may feel proud to be here if you are Indian.
